title: Alex
description: Alexandria the bride of the Mediterranean, located in the northern part of Egypt along the Mediterranean Sea. Alexandria became one of the main commercial hubs in the Mediterranean. In addition to tourism, archaeological sites, and beaches that attract tourists fromall over the world.

title: Dahab
description: Dahab is a small Egyptian town on the southeast coast of the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, approximately 80 km northeast of Sharm el-Sheikh. Formerly a Bedouin fishing village, Dahab is now considered to be one of Egypt' most treasured diving destinations.

title: Fayoum
description: Fayoum is an oasis, situated 100 KM southwest of Cairo, and it’s hands down one of the most scenic destinations in the country. From lush green fields to vast golden deserts from relaxation to adrenaline-fueled activities, Fayoum has it all.

title: Giza
description: Giza is an Egyptian city on the west bank of the Nile, The Giza Plateau is home to iconic Egyptian monuments, including 3 tall pyramids built as royal mausoleums around the 26th century B. the Great Pyramid, is King Khufu’s tomb. The Great Sphinx is a vast sculpture of a man’s head on a lion’s body.

title: Luxor
description: Luxor is a city on the east bank of the Nile River in southern Egypt. It's on the site of ancient Thebes, the pharaohs’ capital at the height of their power, during the 16th–11th centuries B.C. Today's city surrounds 2 huge, surviving ancient monuments: graceful Luxor Temple and Karnak Temple, a mile north.

title: Cairo
description: Cairo is the capital of Egypt, a city rich in world famous history, it is a great place to explore Egyptian history and culture. Even though Cairo is an ancient city; but it is also a modern metropolis. If you are visiting Egypt then Cairo must be on your Itinerary.
